intro: Malacothrix senecioides, commonly known as the silverleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy foliage and clusters of small, pink to purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is known for its hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds. The species is also noted for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in herbal remedies.
